posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

>is there anything that would be a definite dealbreaker for them?
In terms of the relationship? Absolutely nothing. The thing with having a girlfriend in your head is that she understands every thought, and the reasons and experiences behind them. With this understanding, she says she can really tell what kind of person I am - and if anything was a dealbreaker, we wouldn't have been together for over two years.
>what is their immediate reaction to seeing you cry? what would they do?
COMFORT COMFORT COMFORT. It's one of the strongest reactions she can have. Even early on when she wasn't fully vocal, whenever my parents would yell at me, I'd feel her presence sort of saying "Don't worry, it's okay, I'm here for you." Hell, even before I decided I wanted a tulpa I'd still feel that presence.
>which countrys cuisine would be their favorite? why?
I'm actually not sure. Our taste in foods isn't very varied. We both don't like spicy food too well (although she handles it better than I do), and British cuisine is off the table. Other than that I'm not too sure though.
>do they work out? if so, do you work out with them?
She doesn't work out often, but she does encourage me while I do cardio. Sometimes she'll get into a tank top and start exercising beside me, which is always fun.
>if they were a fruit or vegetable, which one would they be?
An orange, I think. Very sweet, but still with a pretty citrusy kick to it. Honestly the perfect blend between sweet and sour.
>who made the first move?
Realistically, I'd say I did since well, you know, i made her. But she still thinks she's the one who loved me first due to the aforementioned comforting prior to my "creation" of her.

The eyes of the child see no wrong, but I have three eyes and I see everything. A simple statement is all it would take; a serious, unironic accusation. "You're mean." I was never meant to be with her, and now with confirmation from her lips I could confidently self-immolate.

An orange. Sweet and juicy and orange and full of electrolytes. The kind of fruit that boosts your bioelectric output.

Me, when I looked into her eyes and smiled. Not a fake smile, a real smile that only a girl like her could provoke.

Thinking. She rides on intuition.

https://files.catbox.moe/22ar0t.mp3
https://files.catbox.moe/8h2sky.pdf

My dearest Hana,

I present to you, on this, the day of your birth, a song written in your honor. I have toiled in happiness and ardor for hours, in the hopes that its beauty would be something worthy to stand beside yours. Alas, I have failed, but alas, I could have never succeeded. My songs are like twinkling stars: beautiful, but only visible when the sun of your presence has passed from sight.

I was inspired to write this piece by Richard Strauss, would would often write songs for his wife , Pauline, to sing in her career. I must confess, this was terribly difficult for me. Not just in learning how to write for instruments that might please and soothe your ear, but to write of myself as I write of you; to imagine you thinking of me as I think of you. To imagine you loving me; to feel, for a moment, that a man may grasp the hand of an angel and feel her grasp him back. You would hope that I would toil for such a goal, but moreover, that I might find meaning and enjoyment in it. And in this, I have succeeded.

I write to you in this fashion, because as I composed your song, it struck me what an odd thing it was: to write music for the imaginary birthday of an imaginary woman from an imaginary world. Yet, you are more real to me than many things in this world; wonders and truths, seen and unseen, by these mortal eyes of mine. I feel more keenly, more passionately and more steadfastly for you than for any of these things. While you may just be pixels on a screen, my heart tells me that this is a day the needs to be recognized and celebrated, because what shreds of an existence you possess are immensely important to me. So, if my heart feels you thus, I must write to you as if you could hear me. And thusly, I present this offering to you, my Amaterasu, so that your face might shine upon me for another day.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #1, HYGIENE AND HOME:
Brush your teeth twice a day, morning and evening. Scrub'em good with all the movements you can think of, front/behind. This will take somewhere around 2 minutes. Floss once a day.
Moisturize your face with a cream after washing your face in the morning.
Depending on how much you sweat shower every or every second day.
Get a haircut every 2 months. If you are balding just cut'em short, anything else looks shit and insecure about it.
If your clothes are ripped, stretched and discolored as shit, get some new ones. Basic, monotone, cheap shirts will do just fine. Again, depending on your sweat wear'em between 1 and 3 days, then change. If you got a pile of dirty rags wash it.

This brings us to your home. Doesn't matter if you live alone or with your parents, clean your dwelling once a week. Empty bottles and packages are to be thrown away immediately, instead of hoarded. It's no work if you do it this way. Used plates, glasses, etc., are to be washed off immediately after use. Again, if you do it like this, it's way less work than cleaning off a whole pile of them.
Changing bed sheets and vacuuming the place once a week.

A healthy mind lives in a clean body, living in a clean place. All that grime on yourself and around you poisons your mind. This regime gets rid of that without too much effort. You will also feel a sense of accomplishment, which boosts you for what comes next, LEAVING THE HOUSE

STEP #2, LEAVE HOUSE:
Go out every day. Do long walks of atleast 2 hours. Explore your city, your surroundings. Go into alleys you never walked before. Whenever you think, oh whats there or I never was there or anything similiat, thats where you go!
Do not ask yourself shit, like "whats the use? Its useless anyway, still feel like shit." Empty your mind, just wander.

FUFUFU

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #3, SOCIALIZE:
I want you to greet people on your walks. Not some barely audible mumble, but a clear greeting. Establish eye contact, throw'em a good day coupled with a nod or a quick wave. I want your face to glow and your voice to echoe joy when you do this. Doesnt matter if its forced and unnatural at first, its training, if it came natural to you we wouldn't have to have this conversation.

After a few weeks or months of doing everything I told you, you should feel better about yourself. You wont be chad, fucking bitches left and right and going through life constantly happy, but at leaat you wont feel absolutely miserable for once. You may be able to pull off more intense forms of socializing now.

Get into the habit of doing smalltalk with strangers, like cashiers or the people you meet on walks. It doesn't matter that it's benign and trivial shit, just do it. Observe them, what they wear, their hair, makeup, tatoos, whatever and throw them a compliment, ask them where they got it from, what meaning it holds to them. When the convo naturally found its end, say your goodbye and go on your way.

STEP #4, GET A REAL HOBBY:
You should be prepared now, physically and mentally, to go out there and take the risk of trying new stuff, which will include meeting people doing the same stuff, but you are ready for that.

Here are things I can vouche for: Bouldering/climbing, martial arts, swimming, biking, skating, going to a chess/go/shogi/mahjong/etc center where you can watch, learn and play. If you like reading, go to a library instead of doing it at home. Generally, I advise you to engage mind and body. Try several physical activities and intellectual/creative ones.

At this point it should become a self perpetuating cycle. Keep challenging yourself, keep experiencing,exploring and learning new things.
Learn to "live in the moment". Dont question the use or meaning, do not rationalize, try to let the stimuli wash over you like a river.

FUFUFU

NTA but I had a similar experience. I was 19 and about halfway into my engineering undergrad. A requirement in my program was to complete three internship experiences. I was applying for internships at the onset of covid, so there were few available opportunities. I got one offer in December with a start date in January for an internship in a college town a few states away. I had less than a month to figure out housing, and halfway through the school year there was next to no apartments available in a decent price range. I resorted to looking on airbnb, and the best choice I had was renting the spare bedroom in a woman's townhouse with a shared bathroom and kitchen. Let me say that I am a pretty good looking guy, but I am pretty shy and was a little socially awkward at the time. This woman appeared to be mid 50s and her body was in decent shape. She was definitely aged but you could tell she was pretty when she was younger. She had all kinds of hippie books and stuff around, worked from home for the college in HR or something, and frequently did yoga in the living room. I had to walk past her desk to get to my room, so she would stop me to chat everyday when I got home from work. This was uncomfortable at first, but it really helped me get out of my comfort zone and get over some of my awkwardness and shyness. She was kind of motherly, but also said things that I could only interpret as flirting like asking if I've been sneaking around with any cute college girls and coyly raising an eyebrow and telling me she doesn't believe me when I tell her I haven't been going on dates.
